title: 90/265/EEC: Council Decision of 7 June 1990 on the alignment of Portuguese prices for certain fruit and vegetables on the common prices
header:
COUNCIL  DECISION
of 7 June 1990
on the alignment of Portuguese prices for certain fruit and vegetables on the common prices
(90/265/EEC)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. For the 1990/91 marketing year, the Portuguese Republic shall fix at a level at least equal to the price provided for in paragraph 2 the basic price and the buying-in price in ecus of the following products:
- apples,
- pears,
- apricots,
- table grapes,
- lemons,
- oranges,
- tomatoes,
- aubergines,
- cauliflowers.
2. The minimum prices applicable in Portugal during the 1990/91 marketing year shall be obtained:
- by calculating as a percentage the gap between the common prices for the said marketing year and the Protuguese prices as recorded in the records of the 1985 negotiation proceedings,
- by reducing that gap by one-sixth.
This Decision is addressed to the Portuguese Republic.
attachments:
Done at Luxembourg, 7 June 1990.
For the Council
The President
P. FLYNN
